choices.name: Get started with research for your Alabama ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Alabama ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Alabama research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Alabama research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Alabama Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Get an overview of Alabama research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Georgia Overview—3:55 - 2018

  3. Follow this research study for Alabama ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Alabama Research, 1880-Present

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Alabama research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Alabama Resources
    ☆ AC—Alabama State Research Guide - 2016

  5. Read the ☆genealogy guide to Alabama research by Barb Snow.

  6. Record Finder: Use the Alabama Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Alabama Record Selection Table

Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic
  1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Alabama in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Alabama
    ☆ FS—Wiki: Alabama Minorities

  2. Learn about African American records for Alabama.

    ☆ AG—Alabama African American Records

  3. Explore the African American Gateway for Alabama.
  4. Native American: Explore Native American research in Alabama on the ☆Genealogy Trails site.
  5. Learn about American Indians in Alabama in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Alabama

choices.name: Learn about Alabama state history.

content.text:
1. Explore Alabama historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Alabama History

  2. Explore Alabama history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Alabama

  3. Learn about Alabama history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Alabama History

choices.name: Learn about Alabama archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Learn about the Alabama Department of Archives and History.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Alabama archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Alabama Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Alabama State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research - 2018

  2. Learn about the resources available at the Birmingham Public Library.

    ☆ FTM—Birmingham Public Library's Genealogy Research Heaven

  3. Sites: Explore the Alabama Dept. of Archives collection.
  4. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Alabama.
  5. Books: Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Alabama genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  6. Search for ☆free online books on Alabama research on the FamilySearch site.

choices.name: Learn about Alabama city directories.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find Alabama ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city and county records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Alabama city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Alabama Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Alabama city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs. - 2012

  4. Explore Alabama city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Counties: Explore Alabama ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Access facts and information for ☆Alabama counties.

QUIKLinks

content.text:
Alabama Obituaries
  1. Learn about Alabama obituaries in this article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Alabama Obituaries

  2. Sites: Explore the ObituariesHelp site for Alabama obituaries.
  3. Explore The Ancestor Hunt for Alabama obituaries.
  4. Search for obituaries by county on the Newspaperobituaries.net site.
  5. Find additional resources for Alabama obituaries on the ☆Linkpendium site.

    6. Alabama Death Records
  6. Learn how to find Alabama death records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: How to Find Alabama Death Records

  7. Sites: Explore the Ancestors at Rest site for Alabama death records.
  8. Explore additional links for Alabama death records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  9. Explore Alabama death records, indexes, and obituaries.
Alabama Obituaries
Alabama Death Records

content.text:
Census
  1. Get an overview of Alabama censuses in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Alabama Census
    ☆ AC—Alabama Census Records

  2. Explore Alabama state census records on the Ancestry site.
  3. Sites: Explore the MyFreeCensus site for Alabama state and county census records.
  4. Explore Alabama census records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  5. Explore additional links for Alabama census records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

    6. Voting
  6. Learn about Alabama voter registers in this article.

    ☆ FS—Alabama Voting Registers
  7. Sites: Find resources for Alabama voter registration database of 1867 on the Alabama Dept. of Archives and History site.

choices.name: Learn about Alabama court and other records.

hidden.content: • Learn about the history of court records in Alabama and where to find them.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for probate and court records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Alabama court records in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Alabama Court Records
    ☆ AC—Wiki: Alabama Court Records
  2. Explore records for district and circuit courts on the National Archives site.
  3. Explore school record resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  4. Explore resources for orphans on the OrphanFinder site.

choices.name: Learn about Alabama maps and gazetteers.

hidden.content:
• Learn about the history of Alabama maps.
  • Find out how Alabama gazetteers can help you in your research.

content.text:
1. Learn about Alabama maps in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Alabama Maps
    ☆ AC—Wiki: Alabama Maps

  2. Learn about Alabama gazetteers in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Alabama Gazetteers

  3. Access interactive maps and atlases of Alabama on the ☆MapsofUS site.
  4. Find Alabama towns and communities on the RoadsideThoughts site.

choices.name: Explore Alabama maps and gazetteers.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for maps and gazetteers. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Explore the ☆David Rumsey collection of Alabama maps.
  2. Find resources for Alabama maps on the Alabama Dept. of Archives and History site.
  3. Explore the ☆Perry-Castaneda site for maps of Alabama.
  4. Explore the historical Alabama maps on the University of Alabama site.
  5. Explore Alabama county maps on the University of Alabama site.
  6. Explore historical Alabama maps on the Historic Map Works site.
  7. Explore the ☆Old Maps Online site for Alabama maps.
  8. Explore the ☆Old Maps of Alabama on the Wikipedia site.

choices.name: Explore Alabama newspapers.

hidden.content:
• Find research clues in the Library of Congress historical newspaper collection.
  • Search Alabama online newspaper sites.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for newspaper records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Search for ☆Alabama historical newspapers in the Library of Congress collection.
  2. Find links to Alabama newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  3. Search the ☆Alabama Online Historical Newspapers site.
  4. Explore Alabama newspaper resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  5. See additional Alabama newspaper resources on the Linkpendium site.
  6. Explore additional links for Alabama newspapers and obituaries on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Alabama County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Alabama.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

choices.name: Explore additional record collections.

content.text:
1. In FamilySearch, explore the Alabama Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Alabama Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Alabama Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the U.S. South Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the Alabama Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Alabama.
  6. Visit Alabama Genealogy - Just Ask!
  7. Visit Alabama Ancestors.

Regional Facebook Pages:

choices.name: Join a mailing list or message board for Alabama research.

content.text:
1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Alabama research.
  2. Explore the Alabama research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Alabama research.

choices.name: Learn about Alabama genealogy societies.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Alabama in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Alabama Societies

  2. Visit the Alabama Genealogical Society sites.
  3. Explore Alabama genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  4. Get help at a family history center in Alabama.
